<h3 align="center">Picture In Picture</h3>

  <p align="center">
    A minecraft mod to create picture in picture windows
    <br />
    </p>
</div>

<!-- ABOUT THE PROJECT -->

## About The Project

![Overlay picture in picture][product-screenshot]

Waiting for storage to fill up, but want to do something else, just create a new window zoom in and overlay it on top of
anything.

Windows can be:
<div style="display: flex; gap: 4px; align-items: center"><img src="images/zoom.png" alt="zoomed" width="20" height="20"><b>Zoomed</b> zoom in to specific things to keep an eye on</div>
<div style="display: flex; gap: 4px; align-items: center"><img src="images/floatable.png" alt="zoomed" width="20" height="20"><b>Floated</b> keep the window above all other programs</div>
<div style="display: flex; gap: 4px; align-items: center"><img src="images/draggable.png" alt="zoomed" width="20" height="20"><b>Dragged</b> drag a window with your mouse around the screen</div>
<div style="display: flex; gap: 4px; align-items: center"><img src="images/force_render_aspect_ratio.png" alt="zoomed" width="20" height="20"><b>Resized</b> make the window smaller while, optionally keeping the minecraft window aspect ratio</div>
<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>

![Overlay picture in picture][product-screenshot-2]

### Supports

[![Mod Menu][Mod Menu]][mod-menu-url]

<!-- ROADMAP -->

## Roadmap

- [x] Add mod menu support
- [ ] Add hide addon
- [ ] Refactor code for multiloader
- [ ] Add multiloader support
    - [ ] forge
    - [ ] fabric

See the [open issues](https://github.com/DJ1TJOO/mod-picture-in-picture/issues) for a full list of proposed features
(and known issues).

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>



<!-- CONTRIBUTING -->

## Contributing

Contributions are what make the open source community such an amazing place to learn, inspire, and create. My open gl
experience is limited, any
contributions you make are **greatly appreciated**.

If you have a suggestion that would make this better, please fork the repo and create a pull request. You can also
simply open an issue with the tag "enhancement".
Don't forget to give the project a star! Thanks again!

1. Fork the Project
2. Create your Feature Branch (`git checkout -b feat/AmazingFeature`)
3. Commit your Changes (`git commit -m 'Add some AmazingFeature'`)
4. Push to the Branch (`git push origin feat/AmazingFeature`)
5. Open a Pull Request

<p align="right">(<a href="#readme-top">back to top</a>)</p>
